Cards.flavor: When a bear rears back and extends his arms, he's about to Swipe!  ... or hug.
Cards.name: Swipe

Cards.flavor: Grow your own mana crystals with this Mana Crystal Growth Kit, only 39.99!
Cards.name: Wild Growth
Cards.text: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.

Cards.flavor: There was going to be a pun in this flavor text, but it just came out baa-d.
Cards.name: Polymorph
Cards.text:
Transform a minion
into a 1/1 Sheep.

Cards.flavor: Playing this card makes you SMARTER.  And let's face it: we could all stand to be a little smarter.
Cards.name: Arcane Intellect
Cards.text: Draw 2 cards.

Cards.flavor: It is customary to yell "Chill out!" or "Freeze!" or "Ice ice, baby!" when you play this card.
Cards.name: Frostbolt
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage to a character and Freeze it.

Cards.flavor: This spell is much better than Arcane Implosion.
Cards.name: Arcane Explosion
Cards.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions.

Cards.flavor: Hey man, that's cold.  Literally and metaphorically.
Cards.name: Frost Nova
Cards.text: Freeze all enemy minions.

Cards.flavor: Oh hey it's Mirror Image! !egamI rorriM s'ti yeh hO
Cards.name: Mirror Image
Cards.text: Summon two 0/2 minions with Taunt.

Cards.flavor: This spell can be very Entertaining.
Cards.name: Blizzard
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemy minions and Freeze them.

Cards.flavor: This spell is useful for burning things.  If you're looking for spells that toast things, or just warm them a little, you're in the wrong place.
Cards.name: Fireball
Cards.text: Deal $6 damage.

Cards.flavor: When the ground is on fire, you should not stop, drop, and roll.
Cards.name: Flamestrike
Cards.text: Deal $4 damage to all enemy minions.

Cards.flavor: Don't summon a water elemental at a party.  It'll dampen the mood.
Cards.name: Water Elemental
Cards.text: Freeze any character damaged by this minion.

Cards.flavor: FROST SHOCK!
Cards.name: Frost Shock
Cards.text: Deal $1 damage to an enemy character and Freeze it.

Cards.flavor: It was just a flesh wound.
Cards.name: Ancestral Spirit
Cards.text: Give a minion "Deathrattle: Resummon this minion."

Cards.flavor: Windfury is like Earthfury and Firefury, but more light and airy.
Cards.name: Windfury
Cards.text: Give a minion Windfury.

Cards.flavor: I personally prefer some non-ancestral right-the-heck-now healing, but maybe that is just me.
Cards.name: Ancestral Healing
Cards.text: Restore a minion to full Health and give it Taunt.

Cards.flavor: He can never take a bath. Ewww.
Cards.name: Fire Elemental
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage.

Cards.flavor: This would be real handy if your enemy is made of rock.
Cards.name: Rockbiter Weapon
Cards.text: Give a friendly character +3 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: blaarghghLLGHRHARAAHAHHH!!
Cards.name: Bloodlust
Cards.text: Give your minions +3 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: Drek'thar can't see, but he can see. You know what I mean? It's ok if you don't.
Cards.name: Far Sight
Cards.text: Draw a card. That card costs (3) less.

Cards.flavor: It’s a Bolt.   It's made out of Shadow.   What more do you need to know!
Cards.name: Shadow Bolt
Cards.text:
Deal $4 damage
to a minion.

Cards.flavor: Imps are content to hide and viciously taunt everyone nearby.
Cards.name: Blood Imp
Cards.text: [x] Stealth. At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.

Cards.flavor: "I've just sucked one year of your life away."
Cards.name: Drain Life
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage. Restore #2 Health to your hero.

Cards.flavor: It's spells like these that make it hard for Warlocks to get decent help.
Cards.name: Hellfire
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage to ALL characters.

Cards.flavor: It starts with stealing a pen from work, and before you know it, BOOOM!  Corrupted!
Cards.name: Corruption
Cards.text: Choose an enemy minion. At the start of your turn, destroy it.

Cards.flavor: "INFERNOOOOOOOOOO!" - Jaraxxus, Eredar Lord of the Burning Legion
Cards.name: Dread Infernal
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage to ALL other characters.

Cards.flavor: No relation to "The Voidsteppers", the popular Void-based dance troupe.
Cards.name: Voidwalker
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: It's funny how often yelling "Look over there!" gets your opponent to turn around.
Cards.name: Backstab
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to an undamaged minion.

Cards.flavor: "I'm cold blooded, check it and see!"
Cards.name: Cold Blood
Cards.text: Give a minion +2 Attack. Combo: +4 Attack instead.

Cards.flavor: Rogues guard the secrets to poison-making carefully, lest magi start incorporating poison into their spells.  Poisonbolt? Rain of Poison?  Poison Elemental?  Nobody wants that.
Cards.name: Deadly Poison
Cards.text: Give your weapon +2 Attack.

Cards.flavor: There's something about this strike that just feels off.  Sinister, even.
Cards.name: Sinister Strike
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage to the enemy hero.

Cards.flavor: If you don't want to be assassinated, move to the Barrens and change your name. Good luck!
Cards.name: Assassinate
Cards.text: Destroy an enemy minion.

Cards.flavor: Rogues are not good joggers.
Cards.name: Sprint
Cards.text: Draw 4 cards.

Cards.flavor: Guaranteed to have been owned by a real assassin.   Certificate of authenticity included.
Cards.name: Assassin's Blade

Cards.flavor: Never play 'Hide and Go Seek' with a Hunter.
Cards.name: Hunter's Mark
Cards.text: Change a minion's Health to 1.

Cards.flavor: "As in, you MIGHT want to get out of my way." - Toad Mackle, recently buffed.
Cards.name: Blessing of Might
Cards.text: Give a minion +3 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Holy beings from the beyond are so cliché!
Cards.name: Guardian of Kings
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #6 Health to your hero.

Cards.flavor: If you are often bathed in Holy Light, you should consider wearing sunscreen.
Cards.name: Holy Light
Cards.text: Restore #6 Health.

Cards.flavor: Prince Malchezaar was a collector of rare weapons. He'd animate them and have them dance for him.
Cards.name: Light's Justice

Cards.flavor: Given the number of kings who have been assassinated, are you sure you want their blessing?
Cards.name: Blessing of Kings
Cards.text: Give a minion +4/+4. (+4 Attack/+4 Health)

Cards.flavor: Consecrated ground glows with Holy energy.  But it smells a little, too.
Cards.name: Consecration
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to all enemies.

Cards.flavor: A good paladin has many tools.  Hammer of Wrath, Pliers of Vengeance, Hacksaw of Justice, etc.
Cards.name: Hammer of Wrath
Cards.text:
Deal $3 damage.
Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: It Slices, it Dices. You can cut a tin can with it. (But you wouldn't want to.)
Cards.name: Truesilver Champion
Cards.text: Whenever your hero attacks, restore #2 Health to it.

Cards.flavor: "Guys! Guys! Slow down!" - some kind of non-warrior minion
Cards.name: Charge
Cards.text: Give a friendly minion Charge. It can't attack heroes this turn.

Cards.flavor: Minion get ANGRY.   Minion SMASH!
Cards.name: Rampage
Cards.text: Give a damaged minion +3/+3.

Cards.flavor: Really, if you're a hero, this is every strike.
Cards.name: Heroic Strike
Cards.text: Give your hero +4 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: During times of tranquility and harmony, this weapon was called by its less popular name, Chilly Peace Axe.
Cards.name: Fiery War Axe

Cards.flavor: It's okay, he deserved it.
Cards.name: Execute
Cards.text: Destroy a damaged enemy minion.

Cards.flavor: No… actually you should fear the Reaper.
Cards.name: Arcanite Reaper

Cards.flavor: Hey you two…could you stand next to each other for a second…
Cards.name: Cleave
Cards.text:
[x]Deal $2 damage to
two random enemy
minions.

Cards.flavor: He can see really far, and he doesn't use a telescope like those filthy pirates.
Cards.name: Earthen Ring Farseer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #3 Health.

Cards.flavor: He likes to think he is powerful, but pretty much anyone can solo Molten Core now.
Cards.name: Magma Rager

Cards.flavor: His dreams of flying and breathing fire like his idol will never be realized.
Cards.name: Oasis Snapjaw

Cards.flavor: Edward "Lefty" Smith tried to make luggage out of a river crocolisk once.
Cards.name: River Crocolisk

Cards.flavor: Grunting is what his father did and his father before that.   It's more than just a job.
Cards.name: Frostwolf Grunt
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: "That's a 50 DKP minus!"
Cards.name: Raid Leader
Cards.text: Your other minions have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Orcish raiders ride wolves because they are well adapted to harsh environments, and because they are soft and cuddly.
Cards.name: Wolfrider
Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: "Bear Carcass 1/10"
Cards.name: Ironfur Grizzly
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: He likes to act like he's in charge, but the silverback matriarch actually runs things.
Cards.name: Silverback Patriarch
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: They're still embarrassed about "The Deathwing Incident".
Cards.name: Stormwind Knight
Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: "Ready! Aim! Drink!"
Cards.name: Ironforge Rifleman
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.

Cards.flavor: In the old days, Kobolds were the finest candle merchants in the land. Then they got pushed too far...
Cards.name: Kobold Geomancer
Cards.text: Spell Damage +1

Cards.flavor: Pirates are into this new fad called "Planking".
Cards.name: Southsea Deckhand
Cards.text: Has Charge while you have a weapon equipped.

Cards.flavor: She's never quite sure what she's making, she just knows it's AWESOME!
Cards.name: Gnomish Inventor
Cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: The Stormpike Commandos are demolition experts.  They also bake a mean cupcake.
Cards.name: Stormpike Commando
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 2 damage.

Cards.flavor: It's good to be a knight.   Less so to be one's squire.
Cards.name: Silver Hand Knight
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/2 Squire.

Cards.flavor: You earn the title of Archmage when you can destroy anyone who calls you on it.
Cards.name: Archmage
Cards.text: Spell Damage +1

Cards.flavor: Just mail him a package with a name and 10,000 gold.  He'll take care of the rest.
Cards.name: Ravenholdt Assassin
Cards.text: Stealth

Cards.flavor: He used to be a 2100+ rated arena player, but that was years ago and nobody can get him to shut up about it.
Cards.name: Lord of the Arena
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: Mrrraggglhlhghghlgh, mrgaaag blarrghlgaahahl mrgggg glhalhah a bghhll graggmgmg Garrosh mglhlhlh mrghlhlhl!!
Cards.name: Murloc Raider

Cards.flavor: They were the inspiration for the championship Taurenball team: The Dragonhawks.
Cards.name: Young Dragonhawk
Cards.text: Windfury

Cards.flavor: This card is boaring.
Cards.name: Stonetusk Boar
Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: "Kill 30 raptors." - Hemet Nesingwary
Cards.name: Bloodfen Raptor

Cards.flavor: He just wants a hug.   A sloppy... slimy... hug.
Cards.name: Bluegill Warrior
Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: Sen'jin Village is nice, if you like trolls and dust.
Cards.name: Sen'jin Shieldmasta
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: He claims it is an old war wound, but we think he just cut himself shaving.

Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 4 damage to HIMSELF.

Cards.flavor: He always dreamed of coming down from the mountains and opening a noodle shop, but he never got the nerve.

Cards.flavor: Golems are not afraid, but for some reason they still run when you cast Fear on them.  Instinct, maybe?  A desire to blend in?
Cards.name: War Golem

Cards.flavor: You can hire him... until someone offers him enough gold to turn on you.
Cards.name: Booty Bay Bodyguard
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: ADD ME TO YOUR DECK, MAGGOT!
Cards.name: Abusive Sergeant
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: Don't bother asking her out on a date.  She'll shoot you down.
Cards.name: Elven Archer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage.

Cards.flavor: Someone did mess with Tuskerr once.  ONCE.
Cards.name: Razorfen Hunter
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Boar.

Cards.flavor: Training Ogres in the art of spellcasting is a questionable decision.

Cards.text: Spell Damage +1

Cards.flavor: "ME HAVE GOOD STATS FOR THE COST"
Cards.name: Boulderfist Ogre

Cards.flavor: You don’t tame a Core Hound. You just train it to eat someone else before it eats you.

Cards.flavor: Their wings are silent but their screech is... whatever the opposite of silent is.
Cards.name: Ironbeak Owl
Cards.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.

Cards.flavor: One Insane Rocketeer.   One Rocket full of Explosives.   Infinite Fun.

Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: When Deathwing assaulted the capital, this soldier was the only member of his squad to survive. Now he's all bitter and stuff.
Cards.name: Stormwind Champion
Cards.text: Your other minions have +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: The Frostwolves are locked in combat with the Stormpike Expedition over control of Alterac Valley.  Every attempt at peace-talks has ended with Captain Galvangar killing the mediator.

Cards.flavor: No Job is too big.  No fee is too big.

Cards.text: Your minions cost (3) more.

Cards.flavor: If you hit an Eredar Lord with enough Wisps, it will explode.   But why?
Cards.name: Wisp

Cards.flavor: I dare you to attack Darnassus.
Cards.name: Ironbark Protector
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: "Look, it's not just about waving daggers around really fast.  It's a lot more complicated than that." - Shan, Rogue Trainer

Cards.flavor: A step up from a spell cast by many beginning acolytes: "Shadow Word: Annoy".

Cards.flavor: They help the downtrodden and distressed.  Also they sell cookies.
Cards.name: Northshire Cleric
Cards.text: Whenever a minion is healed, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Double the trouble. Double the fun!
Cards.name: Divine Spirit
Cards.text: Double a minion's Health.

Cards.flavor: If you feed him, he loses his whole identity.

Cards.text: Whenever you summon a Beast, draw a card.

Cards.name: Darkscale Healer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.

Cards.flavor: "Who let the dogs out?" he asks.  It's rhetorical.
Cards.name: Houndmaster
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly Beast +2/+2 and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: Other beasts totally dig hanging out with timber wolves.
Cards.name: Timber Wolf
Cards.text: Your other Beasts have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Tundra rhinos are often mistaken for kodos.  Or am I mistaken?
Cards.name: Tundra Rhino
Cards.text: Your Beasts have Charge.

Cards.flavor: You see, it's all about throughput.
Cards.name: Multi-Shot
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage to two random enemy minions.

Cards.flavor: For the person who just cannot decide what card to put into a deck!
Cards.name: Tracking
Cards.text: Look at the top 3 cards of your deck. Draw one and discard the others.

Cards.flavor: Magi conjured arcane arrows to sell to hunters, until hunters learned just enough magic to do it themselves.  The resulting loss of jobs sent Stormwind into a minor recession.
Cards.name: Arcane Shot
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage.

Cards.flavor: The longbow allows shots to be fired from farther away and is useful for firing on particularly odorous targets.
Cards.name: Gladiator's Longbow
Cards.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.

Cards.flavor: This spell blasts you directly in the MIND.
Cards.name: Mind Blast
Cards.text: Deal $5 damage to the enemy hero.

Cards.flavor: She’s smaller than her sisters Mediumwarden and Heavywarden.
Cards.name: Lightwarden
Cards.text: Whenever a character is healed, gain +2 Attack.

Cards.flavor: He was sent by the Lich King to disrupt the Argent Tournament.   We can pretty much mark that a failure.
Cards.name: The Black Knight
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy an enemy minion with Taunt.

Cards.flavor: She can't wait to learn Power Word: Fortitude Rank 2.
Cards.name: Young Priestess
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, give another random friendly minion +1 Health.

Cards.flavor: Mere devilsaurs no longer excite him.  Soon he'll be trying to catch Onyxia with only a dull Krol Blade.
Cards.name: Big Game Hunter
Cards.targetingArrowText: Destroy a minion with an Attack of 7 or more.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 7 or more Attack.

Cards.flavor: WARNING.  WARNING.  WARNING.
Cards.name: Alarm-o-Bot
Cards.text:
[x]At the start of your turn,
swap this minion with a
   random one in your hand.

Cards.flavor: He trained when he was younger to be an acolyte of joy, but things didn’t work out like he thought they would.
Cards.name: Acolyte of Pain
Cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: "I solemnly swear to uphold the Light, purge the world of darkness, and to eat only burritos." - The Argent Dawn Oath
Cards.name: Argent Squire
Cards.text: Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: There is no beast more frightening (or ridiculous) than a fully enraged chicken.
Cards.name: Angry Chicken
Cards.text: Has +5 Attack while damaged.

Cards.flavor: If you want to stop a worgen from infiltrating, just yell, "No! Bad boy!"
Cards.name: Worgen Infiltrator
Cards.text: Stealth

Cards.flavor: Voodoo is an oft-misunderstood art. But it is art.
Cards.name: Voodoo Doctor
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2 Health.

Cards.flavor: He's in charge of the Annual Scarlet Monastery Blood Drive!
Cards.name: Bloodmage Thalnos
Cards.text: Spell Damage +1 Deathrattle: Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: King Mukla wanders Jaguero Isle, searching for love.
Cards.name: King Mukla
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent 2 Bananas.

Cards.flavor: "Half of this class will not graduate… since they'll have been turned to chickens." - Tinkmaster Overspark, teaching Gizmos 101.
Cards.name: Novice Engineer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Stranglethorn is a beautiful place to visit, but you wouldn't want to live there.
Cards.name: Jungle Panther
Cards.text: Stealth

Cards.flavor: They always have a spare flask of Sunwell Energy Drink™!
Cards.name: Shattered Sun Cleric
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: Never wash your whites with a Scarlet Crusader.
Cards.name: Scarlet Crusader
Cards.text: Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: He's stationed in the Hellfire Peninsula, but he's hoping for a reassignment closer to Orgrimmar, or really anywhere the ground is less on fire.
Cards.name: Thrallmar Farseer
Cards.text: Windfury

Cards.flavor: The first time they tried to guard Silvermoon against the scourge, it didn’t go so well…
Cards.name: Silvermoon Guardian
Cards.text: Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: She is still working on installing the rocket launcher add-on for Mr. Bitey.
Cards.name: Dragonling Mechanic
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/1 Mechanical Dragonling.

Cards.flavor: The wonderful thing about tigers is tigers are wonderful things!
Cards.name: Stranglethorn Tiger
Cards.text: Stealth

Cards.flavor: He really just wants to be your friend, but the constant rejection is starting to really get to him.
Cards.name: Leper Gnome
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to the enemy hero.

Cards.flavor: She doesn’t ACTUALLY walk on the Sun.  It's just a name.  Don’t worry!
Cards.name: Sunwalker
Cards.text: Taunt Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: Harpies are not pleasant sounding.  That's the nicest I can put it.
Cards.name: Windfury Harpy
Cards.text: Windfury

Cards.flavor: Twilight drakes feed on Mystical Energy.  And Tacos.
Cards.name: Twilight Drake
Cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1 Health for each card in your hand.

Cards.flavor: "Does anyone have some extra Boar Pelts?"
Cards.name: Questing Adventurer
Cards.text: Whenever you play a card, gain +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: Why do its eyes seem to follow you as you walk by?
Cards.name: Ancient Watcher
Cards.text: Can't attack.

Cards.flavor: Guardians of Dark Iron Ore.  Perhaps the most annoying ore, given where you have to forge it.
Cards.name: Dark Iron Dwarf
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give a minion +2 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: Spellbreakers can rip enchantments from magic-wielders.  The process is painless and can be performed on an outpatient basis.
Cards.name: Spellbreaker
Cards.text: Battlecry: Silence a minion.

Cards.flavor: His youthful enthusiasm doesn’t always equal excellence in his brews.   Don’t drink the Mogu Stout!
Cards.name: Youthful Brewmaster
Cards.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.

Cards.flavor: She’s trying to kick the habit, but still takes some mana whenever she has a stressful day.
Cards.name: Mana Addict
Cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain +2 Attack this turn.

Cards.flavor: Most pandaren say his brew tastes like yak.  But apparently that's a compliment.
Cards.name: Ancient Brewmaster
Cards.targetingArrowText: Return a minion to your hand.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Return a friendly minion from the battlefield to your hand.

Cards.flavor: She carries a shield, but only so she can give it to someone she can stand behind.
Cards.name: Sunfury Protector
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions Taunt.

Cards.flavor: "You'll love my new recipe!" he says... especially if you're not happy with your current number of limbs.
Cards.name: Crazed Alchemist
Cards.targetingArrowText: Swap Attack and Health of a minion.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Swap the Attack and Health of a minion.

Cards.flavor: Oozes love Flamenco.  Don't ask.
Cards.name: Acidic Swamp Ooze
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.

Cards.flavor: The Argent Dawn stands vigilant against the Scourge, as well as people who cut in line at coffee shops.
Cards.name: Argent Commander
Cards.text: Charge Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: She's quite jealous of the Gallon-Sized Summoner.
Cards.name: Pint-Sized Summoner
Cards.text: The first minion you play each turn costs (1) less.

Cards.flavor: She promises not to tell anyone about that thing you did last night with that one person.
Cards.name: Secretkeeper
Cards.text: Whenever a Secret is played, gain +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: He's not really all that crazy, he is just not as careful with explosives as he should be.
Cards.name: Mad Bomber
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split between all other characters.

Cards.flavor: Tinkmaster Overspark nearly lost his Tinker's license after the Great Ironforge Squirrel Stampede of '09.
Cards.name: Tinkmaster Overspark
Cards.targetingArrowText: Transform a minion into a 5/5 or a 1/1 at random.
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Transform another random minion into a 5/5 Devilsaur or a 1/1 Squirrel.

Cards.flavor: The Warsong clan is such drama. It's really not worth it to become a commander.
Cards.name: Warsong Commander
Cards.text: Your Charge minions have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Mind Control technology is getting better, but that's not saying much.
Cards.name: Mind Control Tech
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: If your opponent has 4 or more minions, take control of one at random.

Cards.flavor: Having Arcane golems at home really classes up the place, and as a bonus they are great conversation pieces.
Cards.name: Arcane Golem
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give your opponent a Mana Crystal.

Cards.flavor: You never know who may be secretly working for the Cabal....
Cards.name: Cabal Shadow Priest
Cards.targetingArrowText: Steal a minion that has 2 or less Attack.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Take control of an enemy minion that has 2 or less Attack.

Cards.flavor: You wouldn’t think that Argus would need this much defending.  But it does.
Cards.name: Defender of Argus
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +1/+1 and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: He used to run the black market auction house, but there was just too much violence and he had to move.
Cards.name: Gadgetzan Auctioneer
Cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Always roll need.
Cards.name: Loot Hoarder
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Abominations enjoy Fresh Meat and long walks on the beach.
Cards.name: Abomination
Cards.text: Taunt. Deathrattle: Deal 2 damage to ALL characters.

Cards.flavor: Lorewalker Cho archives and shares tales from the land of Pandaria, but his favorite story is the one where Joey and Phoebe go on a road trip.
Cards.name: Lorewalker Cho
Cards.text: Whenever a player casts a spell, put a copy into the other player’s hand.

Cards.flavor: Laying siege isn't fun for anyone.  It's not even all that effective, now that everyone has a flying mount.
Cards.name: Demolisher
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, deal 2 damage to a random enemy.

Cards.flavor: The Coldlight murlocs reside in the darkest pits of the Abyssal Depths.  So no, there's no getting away from murlocs.
Cards.name: Coldlight Seer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give your other Murlocs +2 Health.

Cards.flavor: His mother said that he was just big boned.
Cards.name: Mountain Giant
Cards.text: Costs (1) less for each other card in your hand.

Cards.flavor: Cairne was killed by Garrosh, so... don't put this guy in a Warrior deck.  It's pretty insensitive.
Cards.name: Cairne Bloodhoof
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 4/5 Baine Bloodhoof.

Cards.flavor: At least he has Angry Chicken.
Cards.name: Leeroy Jenkins
Cards.text: Charge. Battlecry: Summon two 1/1 Whelps for your opponent.

Cards.flavor: There is a high cost to Eviscerating your opponent:  It takes a long time to get blood stains out of leather armor.
Cards.name: Eviscerate
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage. Combo: Deal $4 damage instead.

Cards.flavor: Everyone has a price. Gnomes, for example, can be persuaded by stuffed animals and small amounts of chocolate.
Cards.name: Betrayal
Cards.text: Force an enemy minion to deal its damage to the minions next to it.

Cards.flavor: I wouldn't say I LOVE knives, but I'm definitely a fan.
Cards.name: Fan of Knives
Cards.text: Deal $1 damage to all enemy minions. Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: We will always remember you, "Defender!"
Cards.name: Noble Sacrifice
Cards.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks, summon a 2/1 Defender as the new target.

Cards.flavor: He stole the deed to town years ago, so technically the town is his. He just calls people Scrub to be mean.
Cards.name: Defias Ringleader
Cards.text: Combo: Summon a 2/1 Defias Bandit.

Cards.flavor: Justice sometimes takes the form of a closed fist into a soft cheek.
Cards.name: Eye for an Eye
Cards.text: Secret: When your hero takes damage, deal that much damage to the enemy hero.

Cards.flavor: Perdition's Blade is Ragnaros's back-up weapon while Sulfuras is in the shop.
Cards.name: Perdition's Blade
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 1 damage. Combo: Deal 2 instead.

Cards.flavor: The agents of SI:7 are responsible for Stormwind's covert activities.  Their duties include espionage, assassination, and throwing surprise birthday parties for the royal family.
Cards.name: SI:7 Agent
Cards.text: Combo: Deal 2 damage.

Cards.flavor: I am not sure how you get demptioned the first time.  It’s a mystery!
Cards.name: Redemption
Cards.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to life with 1 Health.

Cards.flavor: When all else fails, nothing beats a swift whack upside the head.
Cards.name: Headcrack
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to the enemy hero. Combo: Return this to your hand next turn.

Cards.flavor: Rogue dance troops will sometimes Shadowstep away at the end of a performance.  Crowds love it.
Cards.name: Shadowstep
Cards.text: Return a friendly minion to your hand. It costs (2) less.

Cards.flavor: "Be Prepared" - Rogue Motto
Cards.name: Preparation
Cards.text: The next spell you cast this turn costs (3) less.

Cards.flavor: The talk around the Ratchet Inn is that this card is too good and should be a Legendary.
Cards.name: Wrath
Cards.text: Choose One - Deal $3 damage to a minion; or $1 damage and draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Druids call it the "Mark of Nature."  Everyone else calls it "needing a bath."
Cards.name: Mark of Nature
Cards.text: Choose One - Give a minion +4 Attack; or +4 Health and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: "Reforestation" is suddenly a terrifying word.
Cards.name: Soul of the Forest
Cards.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a 2/2 Treant."

Cards.flavor: Never look a panther in the eye.  Or is it 'Always look a panther in the eye'?  Well, it's one of those.
Cards.name: Power of the Wild
Cards.text: Choose One - Give your minions +1/+1; or Summon a 3/2 Panther.

Cards.flavor: Another one bites the dust.
Cards.name: Naturalize
Cards.text:
Destroy a minion.
Your opponent draws 2 cards.

Cards.flavor: We are pretty excited about the upcoming release of Dire Wolf Beta, just repost this sign for a chance at a key.
Cards.name: Dire Wolf Alpha
Cards.text: Adjacent minions have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Druids take nourishment from many things: the power of nature, the songbird's chirp, a chocolate cake.
Cards.name: Nourish
Cards.text: Choose One - Gain 2 Mana Crystals; or Draw 3 cards.

Cards.flavor: Cat or Bear?  Cat or Bear?!  I just cannot CHOOSE!
Cards.name: Druid of the Claw

Cards.flavor: These guys just show up and start Keeping your Groves without even asking.
Cards.name: Keeper of the Grove
Cards.text: Choose One - Deal 2 damage; or Silence a minion.

Cards.flavor: Some druids still have flashbacks from strangers yelling "Innervate me!!" at them.
Cards.name: Innervate
Cards.text: Gain 1 Mana Crystal this turn only.

Cards.flavor: The Sholazar Basin is home to a lot of really horrible things. If you're going to visit, wear bug spray.  And plate armor.
Cards.name: Emperor Cobra
Cards.text: Poisonous

Cards.flavor: Balance is important to druids.  This card is perfectly balanced.
Cards.name: Starfire
Cards.text:
Deal $5 damage.
Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Young Night Elves love to play "Who can get the Ancient of War to Uproot?"  You lose if you get crushed to death.
Cards.name: Ancient of War
Cards.text: Choose One - +5 Attack; or +5 Health and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: This may appear weak at frost glance, but it's actually a very ice spell.
Cards.name: Icicle
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it's Frozen, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Just a compilation of napkins of intellect.
Cards.name: Tome of Intellect
Cards.text: Add a random Mage spell to your hand.

Cards.flavor:
"Marco!"
"Polo!"
"Marco!"
"Who dares summon me?!"
Cards.name: Call of the Void
Cards.text: Add a random Demon to your hand.

Cards.flavor: The class is always greener on the other side of the board.
Cards.name: Pilfer
Cards.text: Add a random card to your hand (from your opponent's class).

Cards.flavor: Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt! Lightning Bolt!
Cards.name: Lightning Bolt
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage. Overload: (1)

Cards.flavor: It's like an ocean of liquid magma in your mouth!
Cards.name: Lava Burst
Cards.text: Deal $5 damage. Overload: (2)

Cards.flavor: Westfall is full of dust devils. And buzzards. And crazed golems. And pirates. Why does anyone live here?
Cards.name: Dust Devil
Cards.text: Windfury. Overload: (2)

Cards.flavor: Totem-stomping is no longer recommended.
Cards.name: Totemic Might
Cards.text: Give your Totems +2 Health.

Cards.flavor: Earth Shock? Shouldn't it be "Azeroth Shock"?
Cards.name: Earth Shock
Cards.text: Silence a minion, then deal $1 damage to it.

Cards.flavor: If you Hex a Murloc... it really isn't much of a change, is it?
Cards.name: Hex
Cards.text: Transform a minion into a 0/1 Frog with Taunt.

Cards.flavor: Yo, that's a nice axe.
Cards.name: Stormforged Axe
Cards.text: Overload: (1)

Cards.flavor: Spirit wolves are like regular wolves with pom-poms.
Cards.name: Feral Spirit
Cards.text: Summon two 2/3 Spirit Wolves with Taunt. Overload: (2)

Cards.flavor: Baron Geddon was Ragnaros's foremost lieutenant, until he got FIRED.
Cards.name: Baron Geddon
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, deal 2 damage to ALL other characters.

Cards.flavor: Nothing beats rock.
Cards.name: Earth Elemental
Cards.text: Taunt Overload: (3)

Cards.flavor: If you combine it with Spooned Lightning and Knived Lightning, you have the full dining set.
Cards.name: Forked Lightning
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to 2 random enemy minions. Overload: (2)

Cards.flavor: Unlike bound elementals, Unbound ones really enjoy a night on the town.
Cards.name: Unbound Elemental
Cards.text: Whenever you play a card with Overload, gain +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: An umbrella won't be effective, I'm afraid.
Cards.name: Lightning Storm
Cards.text: Deal $2-$3 damage to all enemy minions. Overload: (2)

Cards.flavor: The ethereals are wrapped in cloth to give form to their non-corporeal bodies. Also because it's nice and soft.
Cards.name: Ethereal Arcanist
Cards.text: If you control a Secret at the end of your turn, gain +2/+2.

Cards.flavor: Magi of the Kirin Tor were casting Cubes of Cold for many years before Cones came into fashion some 90 years ago.
Cards.name: Cone of Cold
Cards.text: Freeze a minion and the minions next to it, and deal $1 damage to them.

Cards.flavor: You'd think you'd be able to control your missiles a little better since you're a powerful mage and all.
Cards.name: Arcane Missiles
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage randomly split among all enemies.

Cards.flavor: Rogues are experts at SHIV-al-ry.
Cards.name: Shiv
Cards.text:
Deal $1 damage.
Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Take the time for an evil laugh after you draw this card.
Cards.name: Pyroblast
Cards.text: Deal $10 damage.

Cards.flavor: When a Water elemental and an Ice elemental love each other VERY much...
Cards.name: Frost Elemental
Cards.text: Battlecry: Freeze a character.

Cards.flavor: What's the difference between a mage playing with Counterspell and a mage who isn't?  The mage who isn't is getting Pyroblasted in the face.
Cards.name: Counterspell
Cards.text: Secret: When your opponent casts a spell, Counter it.

Cards.flavor: This is Rank 1.  Rank 2 is Chocolate Milk Barrier.
Cards.name: Ice Barrier
Cards.text: Secret: When your hero is attacked, gain 8 Armor.

Cards.flavor: "You go first." - Krush'gor the Behemoth, to his pet boar.
Cards.name: Mirror Entity
Cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, summon a copy of it.

Cards.flavor: Yes, he'll fight for you.  BUT HE'S NOT GOING TO LIKE IT.
Cards.name: Felguard
Cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Destroy one of your Mana Crystals.

Cards.flavor: If your spells look like horrifying skulls, let's be honest, you should get to draw some cards.
Cards.name: Mortal Coil
Cards.text: Deal $1 damage to a minion. If that kills it, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: Start with a powerful minion and stir in Shadowflame and you have a good time!
Cards.name: Shadowflame
Cards.text: Destroy a friendly minion and deal its Attack damage to all enemy minions.

Cards.flavor: If you put this into your deck, you WILL lose the trust of your other minions.
Cards.name: Void Terror
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Destroy both adjacent minions and gain their Attack and Health.

Cards.flavor: Warlocks have it pretty good.
Cards.name: Succubus
Cards.text: Battlecry: Discard a random card.

Cards.flavor: Are you lighting a soul on fire? Or burning someone with your OWN soul? This seems like an important distinction.
Cards.name: Soulfire
Cards.text:
[x]Deal $4 damage.
Discard a random card.

Cards.flavor: You probably should avoid siphoning your own soul.  You might create some kind of weird infinite loop.
Cards.name: Siphon Soul
Cards.text: Destroy a minion. Restore #3 Health to your hero.

Cards.flavor: Summoning a doomguard is risky. Someone is going to die.
Cards.name: Doomguard
Cards.text: Charge. Battlecry: Discard two random cards.

Cards.flavor: The Twisting Nether is a formless place of magic and illusion and destroyed minions.
Cards.name: Twisting Nether
Cards.text: Destroy all minions.

Cards.flavor: Mannoroth, Magtheridon, and Brutallus may be dead, but it turns out there are a LOT of pit lords.
Cards.name: Pit Lord
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 5 damage to your hero.

Cards.flavor: NOT LESS THAN 1!  Don't get any ideas!
Cards.name: Summoning Portal
Cards.text: Your minions cost (2) less, but not less than (1).

Cards.flavor: Generally demons are pretty obvious and you don’t need a spell to sense them.
Cards.name: Sense Demons
Cards.text:
Draw 2 Demons
from your deck.

Cards.flavor: Imps like being on fire.  They just do.
Cards.name: Flame Imp
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage to your hero.

Cards.flavor: My advice to you is to avoid Doom, if possible.
Cards.name: Bane of Doom
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a character. If that kills it, summon a random Demon.

Cards.flavor: "TRIFLING GNOME! YOUR ARROGANCE WILL BE YOUR UNDOING!!!!"
Cards.name: Lord Jaraxxus
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your hero and replace it with Lord Jaraxxus.

Cards.flavor: Reserved for enemy spellcasters, evil liches from beyond the grave, and karaoke nights at the Grim Guzzler.
Cards.name: Silence
Cards.text: Silence a minion.

Cards.flavor: You can rationalize it all you want, it's still a mean thing to do.
Cards.name: Shadow Madness
Cards.text: Gain control of an enemy minion with 3 or less Attack until end of turn.

Cards.flavor: Spawn of the Light? Or Pawn of the Lights?
Cards.name: Lightspawn
Cards.text: This minion's Attack is always equal to its Health.

Cards.flavor: "What do you get when you cast Thoughtsteal on an Orc?  Nothing!" - Tauren joke
Cards.name: Thoughtsteal
Cards.text: Copy 2 cards in your opponent's deck and add them to your hand.

Cards.flavor: It isn't clear if people ignore the Lightwell, or if it is just invisible.
Cards.name: Lightwell
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, restore #3 Health to a damaged friendly character.

Cards.flavor: Sometimes it feels like this is all a game.
Cards.name: Mindgames
Cards.text:
Put a copy of
a random minion from
your opponent's deck into the battlefield.

Cards.flavor: This is not just a favor, but a divine one, like helping someone move a couch with a fold out bed!
Cards.name: Divine Favor
Cards.text: Draw cards until you have as many in hand as your opponent.

Cards.flavor: He's been exiled from his home, and all his brothers turned evil, but otherwise he doesn't have a lot to complain about.
Cards.name: Prophet Velen
Cards.text: Double the damage and healing of your spells and Hero Power.

Cards.flavor: A grammatically awkward life saver.
Cards.name: Lay on Hands
Cards.text: Restore #8 Health. Draw 3 cards.

Cards.flavor: This card causes double the trouble AND double the fun.
Cards.name: Blessed Champion
Cards.text: Double a minion's Attack.

Cards.flavor: This card makes something really damp.  Oh wait.  That's "Humidity."
Cards.name: Humility
Cards.text: Change a minion's Attack to 1.

Cards.flavor: "I'm not saying you can dodge fireballs.  I'm saying with this shield, you won't have to."
Cards.name: Argent Protector
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give a friendly minion Divine Shield.

Cards.flavor: Apparently with wisdom comes the knowledge that you should probably be attacking every turn.
Cards.name: Blessing of Wisdom
Cards.text: Choose a minion. Whenever it attacks, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: C'mon Molten Giant!!
Cards.name: Holy Wrath
Cards.text: Draw a card and deal damage equal to its Cost.

Cards.flavor: I dub you Sir Loin of Beef!
Cards.name: Sword of Justice
Cards.text: After you summon a minion, give it +1/+1 and this loses 1 Durability.

Cards.flavor: This spell has been renamed so many times, even paladins don’t know what it should be called anymore.
Cards.name: Hand of Protection
Cards.text: Give a minion Divine Shield.

Cards.flavor: Repentance often comes in the moment before obliteration. Curious.
Cards.name: Repentance
Cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, reduce its Health to 1.

Cards.flavor: The Aldor hate two things: the Scryers and smooth jazz.
Cards.name: Aldor Peacekeeper
Cards.text: Battlecry: Change an enemy minion's Attack to 1.

Cards.flavor: If you haven't heard the Tirion Fordring theme song, it's because it doesn't exist.
Cards.name: Tirion Fordring
Cards.text: Divine Shield, Taunt Deathrattle: Equip a 5/3 Ashbringer.

Cards.flavor: Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham! Wham!
Cards.name: Avenging Wrath
Cards.text: Deal $8 damage randomly split among all enemies.

Cards.flavor: Tauren Warrior: Champion of Mulgore, Slayer of Quilboar, Rider of Thunderbluff Elevators.
Cards.name: Tauren Warrior
Cards.text: Taunt Has +3 Attack while damaged.

Cards.flavor: "Dun da dun, dun da dun": if you've heard an ogre sing this, it's too late.
Cards.name: Slam
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. If it survives, draw a card.

Cards.flavor: "You won't like me when I'm angry."
Cards.name: Battle Rage
Cards.text: Draw a card for each damaged friendly character.

Cards.flavor: If an Amani berserker asks "Joo lookin' at me?!", the correct response is "Nah, mon".
Cards.name: Amani Berserker
Cards.text: Has +3 Attack while damaged.

Cards.flavor: All these guys ever do is talk about the Thunder King.   BOOOORRRINNG!
Cards.name: Mogu'shan Warden
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: 50% off fist weapons, limited time only!
Cards.name: Arathi Weaponsmith
Cards.text: Battlecry: Equip a 2/2 weapon.

Cards.flavor: No Pain, No Gain.
Cards.name: Gurubashi Berserker
Cards.text: Whenever this minion takes damage, gain +3 Attack.

Cards.flavor: The way to tell seasoned warriors from novice ones: the novices yell "wheeeee" while whirlwinding.
Cards.name: Whirlwind
Cards.text: Deal $1 damage to ALL minions.

Cards.flavor: She accepts guild funds for repairs!
Cards.name: Armorsmith
Cards.text: Whenever a friendly minion takes damage, gain 1 Armor.

Cards.flavor: Have you seen the size of the shields in this game??  This is no easy job.
Cards.name: Shieldbearer
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: Do you know the first rule of Brawl Club?
Cards.name: Brawl
Cards.text: Destroy all minions except one. (chosen randomly)

Cards.flavor: "If you only use one ability, use Mortal Strike." - The Warrior Code, Line 6
Cards.name: Mortal Strike
Cards.text: Deal $4 damage. If you have 12 or less Health, deal $6 instead.

Cards.flavor: Easily worth 50 DKP.
Cards.name: Upgrade!
Cards.text: If you have a weapon, give it +1/+1. Otherwise equip a 1/3 weapon.

Cards.flavor: "What is a better weapon? The sharp one your enemies expect, or the blunt one they ignore?" - The Art of Warrior, Chapter 9
Cards.name: Shield Slam
Cards.text: Deal 1 damage to a minion for each Armor you have.

Cards.flavor: Grommash Hellscream's famous axe.  Somehow this ended up in Prince Malchezaar's possession.  Quite the mystery!
Cards.name: Gorehowl
Cards.text: Attacking a minion costs 1 Attack instead of 1 Durability.

Cards.flavor: If he's raging now, just wait until he gets nerfed.
Cards.name: Raging Worgen
Cards.text: Has +1 Attack and Windfury while damaged.

Cards.flavor: Grommash drank the tainted blood of Mannoroth, dooming the orcs to green skin and red eyes!  Maybe not his best decision.
Cards.name: Grommash Hellscream
Cards.text: Charge Has +6 Attack while damaged.

Cards.flavor: "Death will rise, from the tides!"
Cards.name: Murloc Tidehunter
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 1/1 Murloc Scout.

Cards.flavor: Do Murlocs ever get tired of making the same old sound?  Nope!  Mrglglrglglglglglglgl!
Cards.name: Murloc Warleader
Cards.text: Your other Murlocs have +2 Attack.

Cards.flavor: These are the brainy murlocs.  It turns out that doesn’t mean much.
Cards.name: Grimscale Oracle
Cards.text: Your other Murlocs have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: This guy gets crazy strong at family reunions.
Cards.name: Murloc Tidecaller
Cards.text: Whenever you summon a Murloc, gain +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: He’s not really that patient. It just takes a while for someone to walk by that he can actually reach.
Cards.name: Patient Assassin
Cards.text: Stealth Poisonous

Cards.flavor: Hyenas prefer the bones of kodos or windserpents, but they'll eat pretty much anything.  Even Brussels sprouts.
Cards.name: Scavenging Hyena
Cards.text: Whenever a friendly Beast dies, gain +2/+1.

Cards.flavor: Sometimes it's as simple as putting on a fake mustache and pointing at someone else.
Cards.name: Misdirection
Cards.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, instead it attacks another random character.

Cards.flavor: In the jungle, the mighty jungle, the lion gets slowly consumed by hyenas.
Cards.name: Savannah Highmane
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon two 2/2 Hyenas.

Cards.flavor: First Lesson: Put the pointy end in the other guy.
Cards.name: Eaglehorn Bow
Cards.text: [x]Whenever a friendly Secret is revealed, gain +1 Durability.

Cards.flavor: Pull the pin, count to 5, then shoot.  Then duck.
Cards.name: Explosive Shot
Cards.text: Deal $5 damage to a minion and $2 damage to adjacent ones.

Cards.flavor: You must read the name of this card out loud each time you play it.
Cards.name: Unleash the Hounds
Cards.text: For each enemy minion, summon a 1/1 Hound with Charge.

Cards.flavor: "Kill!", he commanded.
Cards.name: Kill Command
Cards.text:
Deal $3 damage. If you control a Beast, deal
$5 damage instead.

Cards.flavor: The best defense against King Krush is to have someone you don’t like standing in front of you.
Cards.name: King Krush
Cards.text: Charge

Cards.flavor: Not only does it reveal your enemies, but it's also great for parties!
Cards.name: Flare
Cards.text: All minions lose Stealth. Destroy all enemy Secrets. Draw a card.

Cards.flavor: The seething wrath is just beneath the surface.  Beneath that is wild abandon, followed by slight annoyance.
Cards.name: Bestial Wrath
Cards.text: Give a friendly Beast +2 Attack and Immune this turn.

Cards.flavor: Why did it have to be snakes?
Cards.name: Snake Trap
Cards.text: Secret: When one of your minions is attacked, summon three 1/1 Snakes.

Cards.flavor: "Overheat threshold exceeded. System failure. Wheat clog in port two. Shutting down."
Cards.name: Harvest Golem
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 2/1 Damaged Golem.

Cards.flavor: Nat Pagle, Azeroth's premier fisherman!  He invented the Auto-Angler 3000, the Extendo-Pole 3000, and the Lure-o-matic 2099 (still in testing).
Cards.name: Nat Pagle
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, you have a 50% chance to draw an extra card.

Cards.flavor: “That belongs in the Hall of Explorers!”
Cards.name: Harrison Jones
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon and draw cards equal to its Durability.

Cards.flavor: Antonidas was the Grand Magus of the Kirin Tor, and Jaina's mentor.  This was a big step up from being Grand Magus of Jelly Donuts.
Cards.name: Archmage Antonidas
Cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, add a 'Fireball' spell to your hand.

Cards.flavor: Time to write some flavor text.
Cards.name: Nozdormu
Cards.text: Players only have 15 seconds to take their turns.

Cards.flavor: Alexstrasza the Life-Binder brings life and hope to everyone.  Except Deathwing.  And Malygos.  And Nekros.
Cards.name: Alexstrasza
Cards.text: Battlecry: Set a hero's remaining Health to 15.

Cards.flavor: Onyxia long manipulated the Stormwind Court by disguising herself as Lady Katrana Prestor.   You would have thought that the giant wings and scales would have been a giveaway.
Cards.name: Onyxia
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon 1/1 Whelps until your side of the battlefield is full.

Cards.flavor: Malygos hates it when mortals use magic.  He gets so mad!
Cards.name: Malygos
Cards.text: Spell Damage +5

Cards.flavor: The Faceless Ones are servants of Yogg-Saron, and they feed on fear. Right now they are feeding on your fear of accidentally disenchanting all your good cards.
Cards.name: Faceless Manipulator
Cards.targetingArrowText: Become a copy of a minion.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a minion and become a copy of it.

Cards.flavor: Totemsmiths like to use the rarest woods for their totems.  There are even rumors of totems made of Ironbark Protectors.
Cards.name: Flametongue Totem
Cards.text: Adjacent minions have +2 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Orgrim Doomhammer gave this legendary weapon to Thrall.  His name is a total coincidence.
Cards.name: Doomhammer

Cards.flavor: Is it cold in here or is it just Sindragosa?

Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a random enemy minion and Freeze it.

Cards.flavor: Brrr, it's cold in here. Let's hope she doesn't have an Auctioneer!
Cards.name: Bring It On!
Cards.text: Gain 10 Armor. Reduce the Cost of minions in your opponent's hand by (2).

Cards.flavor: "I recognize your effort but I think your magic still has room for improvement." - Sindragosa after taking a class on giving constructive feedback.
Cards.name: Sindragosa
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon two 0/1 Frozen Champions.

Cards.flavor: As a young blood-princess she learned the proper way for a lady to curtsy, how to address fellow members of royalty, and how to bite them.
Cards.name: Blood-Queen Lana'thel
Cards.text: [x]Lifesteal Has +1 Attack for each card you've discarded this game.

Cards.flavor: Once you both get comfortable, darkness is actually pretty snuggly.
Cards.name: Embrace Darkness
Cards.text:
[x]Choose an enemy minion.
At the start of your turn,
gain control of it.

Cards.flavor: It's tacky to call it "Shadeblade."
Cards.name: Shadowblade
Cards.text: Battlecry: Your hero is Immune this turn.

Cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to buff his brothers.
Cards.name: Prince Keleseth
Cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 2-Cost cards, give all minions in your deck +1/+1.

Cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one wants to copy others.
Cards.name: Prince Taldaram
Cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 3-Cost cards, transform into a 3/3 copy of a minion.

Cards.flavor: Three Princes stand before you. This one devours one after another.
Cards.name: Prince Valanar
Cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no 4-Cost cards, gain Lifesteal and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: There must always be a Lick King.
Cards.name: Arfus
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Add a random Death Knight card to your hand.

Cards.flavor: Don't be fooled, that polar bear's the one in charge.
Cards.name: Hyldnir Frostrider
Cards.text: Battlecry: Freeze your other minions.

Cards.flavor: Spells offer twice the moisture wicking of cotton.
Cards.name: Spellweaver
Cards.text: Spell Damage +2

Cards.flavor: He's so hot right now.
Cards.name: Bolvar, Fireblood
Cards.text: Divine Shield After a friendly minion loses Divine Shield, gain +2 Attack.

Cards.flavor: An eye for an eye, and a ghoul for a ghoul.
Cards.name: Necrotic Geist
Cards.text: Whenever one of your other minions dies, summon a 2/2 Ghoul.

Cards.flavor: Drakkari sorceresses have the irritating habit of repeating themselves at the end of every sentence. Every sentence.
Cards.name: Drakkari Enchanter
Cards.text: Your end of turn effects trigger twice.

Cards.flavor: He's a mind breaker, dream taker, ghoul trainer, don't you mess around with him.
Cards.name: Mindbreaker
Cards.text: Hero Powers are disabled.

Cards.flavor: Have some! This drink is to die for!
Cards.name: Sanguine Reveler
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion and gain +2/+2.

Cards.flavor: It's minions like these that give normal, law-abiding skeletons a bad rap.
Cards.name: Wicked Skeleton
Cards.text: Battlecry: Gain +1/+1 for each minion that died this turn.

Cards.flavor: Queen Lana'thel insists on one of these, fried, every morning for breakfast.
Cards.name: Bloodworm
Cards.text: Lifesteal

Cards.flavor: It turns out you CAN take it with you.
Cards.name: Spectral Pillager
Cards.targetingArrowText: Deal 1 damage for each other card played this turn.
Cards.text: [x]Combo: Deal damage equal to the number of other cards you've played this turn.

Cards.flavor: "What are your strengths?" the interviewer asked. "Well," she replied, "I'm really good at keening."
Cards.name: Keening Banshee
Cards.text: Whenever you play a card, remove the top 3 cards of your deck.

Cards.flavor: Her extensive collection of corpses includes one of nearly every type.  She'd love for you to join it.
Cards.name: Corpsetaker
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Gain Taunt if your deck has a Taunt minion. Repeat for Divine Shield, Lifesteal, Windfury.

Cards.flavor: The love she shares seems to go nowhere. Now she's lost her Light, tosses and turns, she can't sleep at night...
Cards.name: Tainted Zealot
Cards.text: Divine Shield Spell Damage +1

Cards.flavor: Everybody! Hit the deck!
Cards.name: Psychic Scream
Cards.text: Shuffle all minions into your opponent's deck.

Cards.flavor: Fortunately he has an even number of fingers.
Cards.name: Vulgar Homunculus
Cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Deal 2 damage to your hero.

Cards.flavor: Kobolds sort books using a gooey decimal system.
Cards.name: Kobold Librarian
Cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a card. Deal 2 damage to your hero.

Cards.flavor: "Don't worry about the fine print. Just sign here."
Cards.name: Dark Pact
Cards.text: Destroy a friendly minion. Restore #4 Health to your hero.

Cards.flavor: The hook is just an accessory. He can reave just fine without it.
Cards.name: Hooked Reaver
Cards.text: Battlecry: If you have 15 or less Health, gain +3/+3 and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: What’s worse? Seeing the spider, or NOT seeing the spider, but knowing it’s somewhere in your deck?
Cards.name: Fal'dorei Strider
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Shuffle 3 Ambushes into your deck. When drawn, summon a 4/4 Spider.

Cards.flavor: They call her the candled vandal.
Cards.name: Cavern Shinyfinder
Cards.text: Battlecry: Draw a weapon from your deck.

Cards.flavor: What is best in life? To make candle. To keep candle. To hear lamentations of candle-takers.
Cards.name: Kobold Barbarian
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, attack a random enemy.

Cards.flavor:
A purple stone Azari carved
For dark hearts, craving, power-starved.
The first to bow, the warlock Rin,
Embraced the darkness, slew her kin.
Cards.name: Lesser Amethyst Spellstone
Cards.text: Lifesteal. Deal $3 damage to a minion. (Take damage from your cards to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: CAUTION: DO NOT SCRATCH NOSE.
Cards.name: Bladed Gauntlet
Cards.text: Has Attack equal to your Armor. Can't attack heroes.

Cards.flavor: Make like a tree… and gain armor.
Cards.name: Barkskin
Cards.text: Give a minion +3 Health. Gain 3 Armor.

Cards.flavor: Marketed as a "rust-proof iron golem."
Cards.name: Ironwood Golem
Cards.text: Taunt Can only attack if you have 3 or more Armor.

Cards.collectionText: Deal $2 damage to a minion. (Gain 3 Armor to upgrade.)
Cards.flavor:
In ancient woods, elves fought the curse
The demon’s shadow to disperse
But hatred raged and frail souls turned
Now horned and hooved their forests burned.
Cards.name: Lesser Jasper Spellstone
Cards.text: Deal $2 damage to a minion. @(Gain 3 Armor to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor:
Three paths diverged in a darkened hall, and I –
I took the one less traveled by,
And got eaten by a slime.
Cards.name: Branching Paths
Cards.text: [x]Choose Twice - Draw a card; Give your minions +1 Attack; Gain 6 Armor.

Cards.flavor: Astral kitty litter is surprisingly hard to find.
Cards.name: Astral Tiger
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Shuffle a copy of this minion into your deck.

Cards.flavor: Shamans always have the firmest handshakes.
Cards.name: Crushing Hand
Cards.text: Deal $8 damage to a minion. Overload: (3)

Cards.flavor: To truly understand candles, it takes YEARS of quiet contemplation.
Cards.name: Kobold Hermit
Cards.text: Battlecry: Choose a basic Totem. Summon it.

Cards.collectionText: Summon 1 copy of a friendly minion. (Overload 3 Mana Crystals to upgrade.)
Cards.flavor:
A stone of blue, embraced with glee
By murloc lords beneath the sea
Soon numberless they swarmed the shore
First two, then four, then more...and more...
Cards.name: Lesser Sapphire Spellstone
Cards.text: Summon 1 copy of a friendly minion. @(Overload 3 Mana Crystals to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: His clothing is "ratty" in more ways than one.
Cards.name: Sewer Crawler
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 2/3 Giant Rat.

Cards.flavor: Wolves to the left and arrows to the right, here I am stuck in the middle with you.
Cards.name: Flanking Strike
Cards.text: Deal $3 damage to a minion. Summon a 3/3 Wolf.

Cards.flavor: Can be upgraded into a Cave Lurker.
Cards.name: Cave Hydra
Cards.text:
Also damages the minions next to whomever
this attacks.

Cards.flavor: Not all who wander are lost. This one is lost though, for sure.
Cards.name: Wandering Monster
Cards.text: Secret: When an enemy attacks your hero, summon a 3-Cost minion as the new target.

Cards.flavor:
An emerald stone for Tauren hands
Who sought its strength to save their lands
Their tribes now lost, their rage released
Who’s hunting now? And who’s the beast?
Cards.name: Lesser Emerald Spellstone
Cards.text: Summon two 3/3 Wolves. (Play a Secret to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: Rhok'delar is ready to Rhok'de'casbah!
Cards.name: Rhok'delar
Cards.text: Battlecry: If your deck has no minions, fill your hand with Hunter spells.

Cards.flavor: Also known as "Liquid Courage."
Cards.name: Potion of Heroism
Cards.text: Give a minion Divine Shield. Draw a card.

Cards.collectionText: Summon a 2/2 Spirit with Taunt. (Restore 3 Health to upgrade.)
Cards.flavor:
In ages old, when Ancients broke
Azari of the Legion spoke
To tempt the mortals: gems of power
 The weak succumbed, their souls devoured.
Cards.name: Lesser Pearl Spellstone
Cards.text: Summon a 2/2 Spirit with Taunt. @(Restore 3 Health to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: More personal than a text to arms.
Cards.name: Call to Arms
Cards.text: [x]Recruit 3 minions that cost (2) or less.

Cards.flavor: Sometimes it's safer NOT to read the warning signs.
Cards.name: Explosive Runes
Cards.text: Secret: After your opponent plays a minion, deal $6 damage to it and any excess to their hero.

Cards.collectionText: Add 1 random Mage spell to your hand. (Play 2 Elementals to upgrade.)
Cards.flavor:
The final stone undid its master
Spun into wards by nameless caster
Azari wailed a savage roar
Now sealed in nether, evermore.
Cards.name: Lesser Ruby Spellstone
Cards.text: Add 1 random Mage spell to your hand. @(Play 2 Elementals to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: Next turn, this is going to be AMAZING.
Cards.name: Shifting Scroll
Cards.text: Each turn this is in your hand, transform it into a random Mage spell.

Cards.flavor: "Pick a card, any card. Wait! No! Not that one!" - Last words of previous owner
Cards.name: Deck of Wonders
Cards.text: Shuffle 5 Scrolls into your deck. When drawn, cast a random spell.

Cards.flavor: PHENOMENAL ARCANE POWER…itty bitty living space.
Cards.name: Aluneth
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, draw 3 cards.

Cards.flavor: Back in my day, we had to manually scorp.
Cards.name: Scorp-o-matic
Cards.targetingArrowText: Destroy a minion with 1 or less Attack.
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a minion with 1 or less Attack.

Cards.flavor: Takes double damage from wick-based weapons.
Cards.name: Wax Elemental
Cards.text: Taunt Divine Shield

Cards.flavor: Having a furnace-mouth is really handy for a blacksmith.
Cards.name: Ebon Dragonsmith
Cards.text: Battlecry: Reduce the Cost of a random weapon in your hand by (2).

Cards.flavor: The result of centuries of terrible sanitation.
Cards.name: Corrosive Sludge
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy your opponent's weapon.

Cards.flavor: He is a champion, with no friends. He'll keep on fighting, til the end!
Cards.name: Lone Champion
Cards.text: Battlecry: If you control no other minions, gain Taunt and Divine Shield.

Cards.flavor: He got that way from looking into a mirror.
Cards.name: Stoneskin Basilisk
Cards.text: Divine Shield Poisonous

Cards.flavor: Tyrant is such a strong word.
Cards.name: Arcane Tyrant
Cards.text: Costs (0) if you've cast a spell that costs (5) or more this turn.

Cards.flavor: This card really breaks out of the mold.
Cards.name: Green Jelly
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, summon a 1/2 Ooze with Taunt.

Cards.flavor: A pair of stout dwarves nearly averted the Cataclysm.
Cards.name: Dragonslayer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 6 damage to a Dragon.

Cards.flavor: Do you want to eat an adventurer?  I want to eat an adventurer!
Cards.name: Toothy Chest
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, set this minion's Attack to 4.

Cards.flavor: The result of a tragic accident involving a Defias Thug, a Wand of Polymorph, and a bundle of Fel Lotus.
Cards.name: Sneaky Devil
Cards.text: Stealth Your other minions have +1 Attack.

Cards.flavor: Local villagers call her "Naps Under the Mountain."
Cards.name: Sleepy Dragon
Cards.text: Taunt

Cards.flavor: Keeps his two cents to himself.
Cards.name: Hoarding Dragon
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Give your opponent two Coins.

Cards.flavor: It likes the smell of dead things, which is curious, as it has no visible nose.
Cards.name: Corridor Creeper
Cards.text: Costs (1) less whenever a minion dies while this is in your hand.

Cards.flavor: Behold, the unstoppable power of MOSS!
Cards.name: Furbolg Mossbinder
Cards.text: Battlecry: Transform a friendly minion into a 6/6 Elemental.

Cards.flavor: As a kid, she fought with rocks.  Now she fights with ROCK!
Cards.name: Boisterous Bard
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give your other minions +1 Health.

Cards.flavor: It's wurms all the way down.
Cards.name: Violet Wurm
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon seven 1/1 Grubs.

Cards.flavor: The mole of La Mancha rides again!
Cards.name: Gravelsnout Knight
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a random 1-Cost minion for your opponent.

Cards.flavor: He's always grumpy until he's eaten his first barista of the morning.
Cards.name: Carnivorous Cube
Cards.text: Battlecry: Destroy a friendly minion. Deathrattle: Summon 2 copies of it.

Cards.flavor: Love like you've never been hurt. Dance like a 1/1 is watching.
Cards.name: Sonya Shadowdancer
Cards.text: After a friendly minion dies, add a 1/1 copy of it to your hand. It costs (1).

Cards.flavor: Fungalmancy is the easy major for those who can't cut it at Waxmancy.
Cards.name: Fungalmancer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Give adjacent minions +2/+2.

Cards.flavor: Quoth the raven, 'Does yours cost more?'
Cards.name: Raven Familiar
Cards.text: Battlecry: Reveal a spell in each deck. If yours costs more, draw it.

Cards.flavor: “C’mon Hucklemuck. She’ll never notice if we take just one little coin.”
Cards.name: Dragon's Fury
Cards.text: Reveal a spell from your deck. Deal damage equal to its Cost to all minions.

Cards.flavor: Float like a Faerie Dragon, sting like a Hivequeen.
Cards.name: Silver Vanguard
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Recruit an 8-Cost minion.

Cards.flavor: If you’re experiencing resurrection sickness, press 1.
Cards.name: Twilight's Call
Cards.text: Summon 1/1 copies of 2 friendly Deathrattle minions that died this game.

Cards.flavor: A courser is a courser of course, of course, she's more of a unicorn than a horse...
Cards.name: Shimmering Courser
Cards.text:
Only you can target
this with spells and
Hero Powers.

Cards.flavor:
To dwarves of stone the demon called
With promises of might, enthralled
In grasping greed they found their doom
Forever bound in mithril tombs.
Cards.name: Lesser Mithril Spellstone
Cards.text: Summon one 5/5 Mithril Golem. (Equip a weapon to upgrade.)

Cards.flavor: Reported.
Cards.name: Cheat Death
Cards.text: Secret: When a friendly minion dies, return it to your hand. It costs (2) less.

Cards.flavor: Crafted by Deathwing's goblin horde, but the dragon added the rainbow sparkles himself.
Cards.name: Dragon Soul
Cards.text: After you cast 3 spells in a turn, summon a 5/5 Dragon.

Cards.flavor: You thought he was your bro-bold, but turns out he's your foe-bold.
Cards.name: Sudden Betrayal
Cards.text: Secret: When a minion attacks your hero, instead it attacks one of its neighbors.

Cards.flavor: "After that gig in Hamlin went south, I swore off rats."
Cards.name: Elven Minstrel
Cards.text: Combo: Draw 2 minions from your deck.

Cards.flavor: Works on weapons, missiles, and taxes.
Cards.name: Evasion
Cards.text: Secret: After your hero takes damage, become Immune this turn.

Cards.flavor: A diet of pure magic is great for the complexion but wreaks havoc on one's mood.
Cards.name: Lynessa Sunsorrow
Cards.text: [x]Battlecry: Cast each spell you cast on your minions this game on this one.

Cards.flavor: I hunt alone.  Well, me and Misha.  And Huffer.  And Leokk.
Cards.name: To My Side!
Cards.text:
[x]Summon an Animal
Companion, or 2 if your
deck has no minions.

Cards.flavor: It's certainly not civilized gibbering.
Cards.name: Feral Gibberer
Cards.text: After this minion attacks a hero, add a copy of it to your hand.

Cards.flavor: Once called Cahn’delar, Shortbow of the Ancient Whisker.
Cards.name: Candleshot
Cards.text: Your hero is Immune while attacking.

Cards.flavor: Ethereal armor dissipates in 6 hours which can cause extreme awkwardness for first time buyers.
Cards.name: Arcane Artificer
Cards.text: Whenever you cast a spell, gain Armor equal to its Cost.

Cards.flavor: Politer than his brother, the cursing disciple, but far more evil.
Cards.name: Cursed Disciple
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 5/1 Revenant.

Cards.flavor: You especially don't want to make a dire mountain out of a dire mole hill.
Cards.name: Dire Mole

Cards.flavor: "Here, taste this." (Slurp) "What is it?" "I don't know, I found it in one of the labs."
Cards.name: Unidentified Elixir
Cards.text: Give a minion +2/+2. Gains a bonus effect in your hand.

Cards.flavor: The kobold stared at the bundle for a long time. “Ah hah!” he said. “It’s a shield.”
Cards.name: Unidentified Shield
Cards.text:
Gain 5 Armor.
Gains a bonus effect in your hand.

Cards.flavor: When all you have is an unidentified maul, everything else looks like an unidentified nail.
Cards.name: Unidentified Maul
Cards.text: Gains a bonus effect in your hand.

Cards.flavor: Side effects guaranteed!
Cards.name: Shroom Brewer
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #4 Health.

Cards.flavor: If you don't keep up with your payments, it'll be a repossessed lackey.
Cards.name: Possessed Lackey
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Recruit a Demon.

Cards.flavor: The Guild used oak trees until they all turned to ash.
Cards.name: Oaken Summons
Cards.text: Gain 6 Armor. Recruit a minion that costs (4) or less.

Cards.flavor: Standard issue recruit gear: 1 silver sword, 1 Lordaeron insignia, 2 bags of crystal kibble.
Cards.name: Crystal Lion
Cards.text: [x]Divine Shield Costs (1) less for each Silver Hand Recruit you control.

Cards.flavor: Favorite sandwich? Grizzled cheese.
Cards.name: Grizzled Guardian
Cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Recruit 2 minions that cost (4) or less.

Cards.flavor: His breath smells like agony and despair, which is still better than most troggs.
Cards.name: Trogg Gloomeater
Cards.text: Taunt Poisonous

Cards.flavor: We suggest crafting Ixlid; he'll grow on you. Literally.
Cards.name: Ixlid, Fungal Lord
Cards.text: After you play a minion, summon a copy of it.

Cards.flavor:
Ding!
Grats.
Cards.name: Level Up!
Cards.text: Give your Silver Hand Recruits +2/+2 and Taunt.

Cards.flavor: All that remained from the first kobold colony: a single talisman and the word "Flamestrike."
Cards.name: Primal Talismans
Cards.text: Give your minions "Deathrattle: Summon a random basic Totem."

Cards.flavor: Horrible secret: The Darkness is immune to Arcane Missiles.
Cards.name: Kobold Apprentice
Cards.text: Battlecry: Deal 3 damage randomly split among all enemies.

Cards.flavor: Sparkliest of the seven deadly sprites.
Cards.name: Greedy Sprite
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Gain an empty Mana Crystal.

Cards.flavor: She prefers calling it "Psionic Tickling."
Cards.name: Psionic Probe
Cards.text: Copy a spell in your opponent's deck and add it to your hand.

Cards.flavor: My name is Marin the Fox. You took my treasure. Prepare to die.
Cards.howToEarn: Unlocked by opening a Kobolds & Catacombs pack.
Cards.howToEarnGolden: Unlocked with the BlizzCon 2017 virtual ticket.
Cards.name: Marin the Fox
Cards.text: Battlecry: Summon a 0/8 Treasure Chest for your opponent. (Break it for awesome loot!)

Cards.flavor: The grumbling grew to a mighty rumbling, and out of the caverns the kobolds came tumbling.
Cards.name: Grumble, Worldshaker
Cards.text: Battlecry: Return your other minions to your hand. They cost (1).

Cards.flavor: Hard time: 6-10 turns for candle-nappin'.
Cards.name: Drygulch Jailor
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Add 3 Silver Hand Recruits to your hand.

Cards.flavor: Look. Cautious Flurries will only get you so far in life.
Cards.name: Reckless Flurry
Cards.text: Spend all your Armor. Deal that much damage to all minions.

Cards.flavor: Perfectly accessorized to attract adventurers.
Cards.name: Gemstudded Golem
Cards.text: Taunt Can only attack if you have 5 or more Armor.

Cards.flavor: Kobolds use anything for armor: Pots, pans, garbage cans… even other kobolds.
Cards.name: Drywhisker Armorer
Cards.text: Battlecry: For each enemy minion, gain 2 Armor.

Cards.flavor: Never let it hold your checkbook.
Cards.name: Voidlord
Cards.text: [x]Taunt Deathrattle: Summon three 1/3 Demons with Taunt.

Cards.flavor: Thrilling adventure! Danger guaranteed! Loot uncertain! Death optional!  Who’s with me?
Cards.name: Gather Your Party
Cards.text: Recruit a minion.

Cards.flavor: It's filled with electrolytes!
Cards.name: Healing Rain
Cards.text: Restore #12 Health randomly split among all friendly characters.

Cards.flavor: The original telemarketer.
Cards.name: Guild Recruiter
Cards.text: Battlecry: Recruit a minion that costs (4) or less.

Cards.flavor: Turn that frown into TWO frowns!
Cards.name: Woecleaver
Cards.text: After your hero attacks, Recruit a minion.

Cards.flavor: There is no candle.
Cards.name: Kobold Monk
Cards.text: Your hero can't be targeted by spells or Hero Powers.

Cards.flavor: How can he be hungry… if he's Ettin!?
Cards.name: Hungry Ettin
Cards.text: Taunt Battlecry: Summon a random 2-Cost minion for your opponent.

Cards.flavor: Qualifications: Born with pointy hat.
Cards.name: Fungal Enchanter
Cards.text: Battlecry: Restore #2 Health to all friendly characters.

Cards.flavor: "Broken longsword is brand new shortsword." - Kobold Proverb
Cards.name: Rummaging Kobold
Cards.text: Battlecry: Return one of your destroyed weapons to your hand.

Cards.flavor: For druids who want to branch out.
Cards.name: Twig of the World Tree
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Gain 10 Mana Crystals.

Cards.flavor: Auditioning for the next Fungal Idol.
Cards.name: Shrieking Shroom
Cards.text:
At the end of your turn, summon a random
1-Cost minion.

Cards.flavor: Wish #1: funnel cakes. Wish #2: funnel cakes. Wish #3: FUNNEL CAKES.
Cards.name: Benevolent Djinn
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, restore #3 Health to your hero.

Cards.flavor: Waking up at the break of dusk is just not as impressive.
Cards.name: Duskbreaker
Cards.text: Battlecry: If you're holding a Dragon, deal 3 damage to all other minions.

Cards.flavor: He can make ANYTHING look like a candle.
Cards.name: Kobold Illusionist
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Summon a 1/1 copy of a minion from your hand.

Cards.flavor: "Ok, your party has defeated the beetle." "I put it on my head." "What?" "I put it on my head. Like a hat."
Cards.name: Plated Beetle
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Gain 3 Armor.

Cards.flavor: Qualifications: Found pointy hat.
Cards.name: Grand Archivist
Cards.text: At the end of your turn, cast a spell from your deck (targets chosen randomly).

Cards.flavor: Signed and sealed, she delivers oblivion.
Cards.name: Rin, the First Disciple
Cards.text: Taunt Deathrattle: Add 'The First Seal' to your hand.

Cards.flavor: RUN FROM SKY CANDLES! THEY BURN! RUN!
Cards.name: Cataclysm
Cards.text: Destroy all minions. Discard your hand.

Cards.flavor: Don't trust the skull.
Cards.name: Skull of the Man'ari
Cards.text: At the start of your turn, summon a Demon from your hand.

Cards.flavor: Recently unearthed in one of the deepest kobold caves. Traded for a large candle.
Cards.name: Val'anyr
Cards.text: Deathrattle: Give a minion in your hand +4/+2. When it dies, reequip this.

Cards.collectionText: Destroy 1 random enemy minion. (Play 3 Deathrattle cards to upgrade.)
